clinical_study.brief_title: Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Double-Dummy, Parallel-Group Comparison of the Remission Rates of Once Daily Treatment With Esomeprazole 20mg and Lansoprazole 15mg for 6 Months in Patients Whose EE Has Been Healed
clinical_study.official_title: Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Double-Dummy, Parallel-Group Comparison of the Remission Rates of Once Daily Treatment With Esomeprazole 20mg and Lansoprazole 15mg for 6 Months in Patients Whose EE Has Been Healed.

brief_summary.textblock: A study to look at the rates of remission (non re-appearance of erosive esomeprazole) when treated with esomeprazole or lansoprazole; in patients in with erosive esomeprazole (EE) that is in remission (i.e. previously healed EE).

primary_outcome.measure: To compare rates of remission (non re-appearance of erosive esomeprazole) when treated with esomeprazole or lansoprazole; in patients in with erosive esomeprazole (EE) that is in remission (i.e. previously healed EE).
primary_outcome.time_frame: Symptoms will be assessed by the investigator at each visit and the patients will undergo an endoscopy at Months 3 and 6

secondary_outcome.measure: To compare endoscopic remission rates through 6 months of treatment with E20 and L15, after initial healing of EE.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Symptoms will be assessed by the investigator at each visit and the patients will undergo an endoscopy at Months 3 and 6

secondary_outcome.measure: The assessment of symptoms in the two treatment groups after 1, 3 and 6 months.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: patients will undergo an endoscopy at Months 3 and 6

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess the safety and tolerability of up to 6 months of treatment with E20 and L15 after initial healing of EE.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Symptoms will be assessed by the investigator at each visit and the patients will undergo an endoscopy at Months 3 and 6

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Episodes of heartburn (described as a burning feeling rising from the stomach or lower part of the chest up towards the neck) for 2 days or more during the last 7 days prior to baseline
- Confirmed diagnosis of Erosive Esophagus, patients must undergo an endoscopy before entering the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any signs of gastrointestinal bleeding at the time of the starting the study.
- Any previous gastric or esophageal surgery.
- Various gastrointestinal diseases as listed in the protocol.
